project.logic

Class GNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • project.logic.GNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains information about task graph node and additional methods to interact with it.
    Author:
    Yaroslav
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GNode

        public GNode(int tExe,
     int index)
        Additional constructor. This constructor is used when we generate multiple random task graphs.
        Parameters:
        tExe - execution time
        index - unique index

      • GNode

        public GNode(int tExe,
     double cx,
     double cy)
        Main constructor. This constructor is used when we create new graph nodes on the workspace.
        Parameters:
        tExe - execution time
        cx - center X coordinate of the node
        cy - center Y coordinate of the node

      • calculatePriority

        public void calculatePriority(int graphCPTime,
                     int graphCPGnodeNumber)
        Calculates priority of the node according to queue type with code 1.
        Parameters:
        graphCPTime - critical path time of the graph
        graphCPGnodeNumber - number of the graph nodes on the path

      • calculateCriticalPaths

        public void calculateCriticalPaths(int direction,
                          int queueType)
        Calculates critical path for time and nodes number.
        Parameters:
        direction - direction of the path
        queueType - queue type code value

      • checkCycles

        public void checkCycles(java.util.ArrayList<GNode> list)
        Checks task graph for cycles. Counts the quantity of the cycles.
        Parameters:
        list -

      • findCycles

        public void findCycles(java.util.ArrayList<GNode> list,
              java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<GNode>> cycles,
              int direction)
        This method searches for cycles in the task graph and store them into list.
        Parameters:
        list - current path to check cycles
        cycles - list of cycles
        direction - 0 or 1 depending on the direction of the checking

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.awt.geom.Point2D p)
        This method is used to check whether graph node contains specified point or not.
        Parameters:
        p - point to check
        Returns:
        true if contains

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method is used to paint task graph node. It contains two parts: index on the top, and execution time value on the bottom.
        Parameters:
        g - paints graphics
